title: Almost 9 years and you still have not changed/fixed how surrender votes work
body:
why are pre 15 votes still not majority rule? And same goes for after 20 min votes,
You're system is half the reason why people afk games because you don't let anyone leave and you don't punish players who intentionally vote no to troll league of legends is a video game a fucking video game we should not be held captive in a 20+ minute game because 1 or 2 players wants to vote no its a joke

replies.body: Simple, its not broken, doesn't need to be fixed.

It is broken tho why should 4 players be stuck in  video game for 20+ minutes because 1 player wants to vote no and then the same thing after 20 minutes majority of the team want to move on but we have 2 trolls voting no shit should be majority rule from 1st surrender

Because its a video game that takes 20+minutes to finish. A lot of the times its 2 people carrying a noob team that want to surrender then when they start winning they dont want to surrender anymore anyway.
THIS NEVER GIVE UP MENTALITY NEEDS TO BE FUCKING DESTROYED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
maybe giving up to early is why you can't climb
I'm level 27 I play for fun not to rip my hair out

Why would you want to not play the game if you queued up to play the game for fun?

Are you just trying to play a game where you are fed and then kill everyone?

If so, go play bots.

i join a game expecting to have fun and not waste my time 1 or 2 players are feeding and ruining for everyone else the rest of the team want to leave and move on (getting away from the troll) GUESS WHAT THEY CANT BECAUSE THE TROLL/BAD PLAYER WANTS TO VOTE NO and now we have to wait 20 minutes before we can semi majority rule surrender but guess what another player wants to vote no trapping the majority of the team in a 30+ minute game and only ever being able to leave when the game is over

that is why the surrender system needs to be a FULL majority rule after 20 minutes and a 15 vote should be a 4/5 not a 5/5
1/2 players should not be the decider to a lost game being over that is the start and cause of allot of toxicity

I would argue that 4 players should not be the decider over 1 player.

4 people saying yes and 1 person saying no is called gang rape.

If you want to play a game where your teammates don't feed, go put yourself against 5 bots. You can quit at anytime and can get fed easily.

You have NO FUCKING IDEA how many games me and my duo have won when 3 other peoples voted to surrender. Let me tell you it would be the difference between me being gold and me being bronze 5 right now.
exactly 1 or 2 players should not be the decider to why the team has to stay in the game the current surrender system is a big reason to alot of the toxicity in this game
The whole point of the new updates and so on is that you have time to come back. Maybe stop wanting to give up and just focus on winning the game you are in

some games are definitely worth abandoning because trying to coordinate a PUG with a losing team comp just wont happen.

But plenty of games are recoverable but surrendered too quickly.

i don't think any game below diamond is worth abandoning. 

i once vs'd an akali irel and they both had over 5 kills by 10mins (i was top lane and my jgler kept trying to gank) and i was only playing tryndamere and i gutter stomped them because yes they knew the champ but they had no idea how to maccro. 

unless you're in an elo where it is punished for your mistakes at no point is low elo worth giving up. 

thats why people say 1 trick a champ. if you 1 trick a champ you know which items to buy in every situation and thats not like "oh but i've been 1 tricking for 6 months now and im still not winning" dude 1 tricking is 100% playing that champ and even trying new builds here and there, knowing cooldowns knowing match ups and so on. 

i've played over 1000 games of tryndamere, master yi and varus as well as 500 games on kled, taliyah, xayah, talon, viegar and malz. and i still try new builds here and there and i know when i can even fck around and do troll builds that still work and i guess thats why i'm finally plat3 now.

when i was silver i thought there was no way i could ever get gold blah blah but points i will always give:

- Mute all at the start of the game. its low elo everyone thinks just like you "i am better than everyone els" when they're not but you are!

- practice tool is your best friend. It's there for a reason, use it because you're only going to get better at combos

- play as if you're 1 v 5 dont ask for help learn the match ups. 

- DO NOT EVER IN YOUR LIFE TYPE IT DOES ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. like kingstix says "do not even say GJ or TY as they will then expect it and if you dont say it later it may tilt them." over dramatic i know but it's so true

maybe if you're a duo or flex, but PUG? the coordination required to come back and the challenge of people giving up just means that the defeat is just drawn out. You want to split to put pressure, and catch up with farm, then watch the team dive a 4v5 then blame you. You want to team fight and get wiped? feel the rage.
If I were in voice chat with all my team members then I'd never give up. But not in PUG.
absolutely never a reason to give up below diamond.

I'd argue that some matches are better surrendered for sanity's sake, even if they're technically winnable. Those tend to be few and far between though.

It annoys the absolute crap out of me when someone gives up at 10 minutes and says S@15 because of one or two mistakes. All you're doing by giving up so early is *guaranteeing* the loss because you couldn't suck it up for even 10 more minutes. If you were going to give up so easily why are you playing ranked at all??
Who's and where does it say anyone is playing ranked
Not explicitly. It was more my little rant than anything, though I can't say it isn't annoying in normals too when someone gives up at 15 when you're 4 kills and no towers down.

that's the complete is normal's I'm here for fun if I'm losing i want to leave and move on and that's how video games have always worked ranked and normals need to have different surrender systems for me i dont play ranked because in normals i dont feel like trying my hardest when you're losing in a 30 40 minute game becaise 2 players want to vote no its wasting other peoples time they could be doing something else

>that's how video games have always worked

What? First of all, if your enemies all gave up at the first sign of being behind, nevermind actually losing, you're not going to have any fun winning because there's just no challenge and no merit to it. Second, that is not how video games have always worked, even in the single player scene (e.g Dark Souls) but _especially_ in multiplayer competitive games.

You say those 2 players are wasting people's time, but by throwing in the towel at the first hint of trouble have you not wasted their time? You're guaranteeing them the loss and therefore wasting the 15-20 minutes they've been playing + queue and lobby times just because you...didn't want a challenge in a competitive game? Normals are more relaxed sure, but the end goal is still to have a good match.

I think i feel so strong about not giving up so much is because i have accounts in almost every elo up to plat. 

bronze and silver are so easily carried purely from macro. wave control and objectives win those games. i Opt for champs that can solo baron at 25mins (with good farm and gold lead) and just put your whole team and your back and give them some free LP.

But yes totally agree that people that give up that early are annoying but also no longer see it after my perma ban on my 3rd gold account because i just mute all so i don't speak. 

A lot of people should not be playing ranked and not because they suck or anything along those lines but purely because their mental isnt in the right spot.
Yep, people think too much about their rank/kda/ego/skins/memes, than the actual game and what they need to do for the team to win it.

I think your bullet point advice is really good. But I disagree about giving up. I think a lot of matches are winnable, but if the team gives up and cant think strategically enough to draw it out and get back in the game, there is no point.
Agree to disagree I think.

I guess that's a great thing to do so we don't keep doing laps XD 

agreed.

ranked is a small game mode compared to normals thats why the surrender system needs to chnage for normals the amount of players who only play league casualy and for fun and dont play ranked no one and i mena no one wants to try thair hardest when they're losing to waste another 20+ minutes because othr players are trapping them in the game
No move o  find a better match sounds alot better it's a video game not life

I'm on both sides of the fence here

Firstly - Yes FFing should be majority rule (as much as it pisses me off if i'm the one doing good and get dragged down by four bonobos)
Secondly - I generally don't FF@15 unless its a massive deficit (or we have an afk/troll/inter), however with a mid/high deficit i definitely try to GTFO at 20, i'd rather go next than suffer through the rest of the game

Generally speaking you'll see me in 3 places, Support (babysitting a retard), Mid (getting inted by my jg) or top (splitting and getting blamed when we lose because my team chose to fight 4v5, while the enemy team is fed)

Of course there are games, where both teams play well, i stick these out, because a ping-pong game is often quite entertaining, but these are rare as fuck for me i find its 1/20 at best

Foxdrop (EU Diamond JG) claims that games are 40/40/20 - 40% chance your team is trash, 40% the enemy team is trash, and 20% you're the deciding factor and he's not completely wrong, but in low elo's its different and i think this is what regularly high elo players ignore, because they haven't been there, in a long time, they don't know how bad it's gotten, most high elo's now were bronze/silver back in Season 3 or prior, when this game wasn't a toxic mess. so they've never experienced the current game state. so when i see shit like, just 1v9, or just pick OP champs and carry, ignore the team etc. it annoys me, High Elo's don't know shit about low elo so they can't pass judgement, they don't get the shit we get in Bronze-Gold (even plat to a point), since they haven't been there in anywhere between 1-8 years.

Now i'm not saying High Elo's never get it, but its rarer, with several friends in Dia+ Elo they rarely talk about the shit they get, i go through their match history's to see what they're building etc. and notice they almost never get 0/10 players, 0/3 yeah, that happens, but rarely anything worse. I've had discussions about gameplay with the High Elo players, and find that only 1/10 of their games have actually inters/trollers unlike low elo where its 9/10 games, and they all say the same thing, if it looks bleak, get out, start another or dodge in champ select (using OP.GG's multiple summoner function to see what your team has done, and what they're streaks are)

I can play like a god (it does happen, albeit rarely) where i snowball my lead, and try to help my team get ahead, but of course we get that one person who went 0/10 Yasuo mid, and spent the game flaming everyone and he starts the FF, but i don't want to FF, but the other 3 do, not because the game is unwinnable, but because no one likes playing with toxic players, for sanity's sake, the FF goes through, which is fair (even if it pisses me off to no end) 

Sanity > Winning a game
